member.name: M:JAudioTags.Testing.Test(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
This is the method we call from outside. It performs a rudimentary test routine. Point it at a test directory containing a bunch of flac and mp3 files and it: 1. Makes a backup of each file 2. Makes some changes to the file 3. Checks that all still seems OK with the file 4. Restores the file from backup
The method above (TestFiles()) controls what tests are done.
This does not prove there are no bugs, it just increases confidence.
member.param: Path to the test directory
Path to a results file
Path to an error log file

member.name: T:JAudioTags.M3UFile
member.summary: Class to represent and check an M3U playlist. It checks that: - URLs point to a site that can be contacted. - Relative paths point to a file. - Absolute paths point to a file. (This is problematic as if the Playlist file being checked resides on a different computer, the absolute path with not be valid on the checking machine. I have not attempted to resolve this problem.) - In a extended file, the filename, track number and track names are correct or blank. It does not check: - That the duration of the file is correct. (I was unable to find a simple way to get the music duration of an audio file from a .Net program.)

member.name: T:JAudioTags.SyncSafe
member.summary: Implements unsynchronization and deunsynchronization methods for use in ID3 tags.

member.name: F:JAudioTags.SyncSafe._Version
member.summary: Version string

member.name: M:JAudioTags.SyncSafe.Unsynchronize(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Takes an array of bytes and 'unsynchronises' it. Additional zero bytes are added whenever a run of more than eleven consecutive 1s are read. This prevents tag data incorrectly being interpreted as synchronisation bits indicating the start of the music data.
USED TO MAKE A TEST FILE TO CHECK THAT DEUNSYNCHRONISATION CODE WORKS.
member.param: The original, unmodified tag data.
member.returns: The data with additional zero btes inserted to break long strings of 1s.

member.name: M:JAudioTags.SyncSafe.DeUnscynchronize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Undoes the transformation implemented by the UnSynchronize() method above. Removes all the inserted zeros rendering the data parseable again.
member.param: The data with embedded Unsynchronization bytes.
member.returns: The data with unsynchronisation bits removed.

member.name: M:JAudioTags.SyncSafe.Generate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates test arrays to debug Unsynchronize and DeUnsynchronize. Use for DEBUGGING ONLY.
member.param: How big should the test array be

member.name: M:JAudioTags.SyncSafe.ToBigEndianSyncSafe(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a normal 32-bit integer to a SyncSafe integer. SyncSafe integers have the most significant bit of each byte set to zero. This leaves only 28 (4 x 7) bits available to represent the numeric value. This prevents integers in tags being misintereted as synchronization bits indicating the start of the actual music.
member.param: The 'normal' integer

member.name: M:JAudioTags.SyncSafe.FromSyncSafe(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a SyncSafe integer to a normal integer.
member.param: The SyncSafe integer.
